gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Dataset access service which allow to extract the data through the dimension defined in the dataset. The purpose of this process is to extract data from a product. A dataset is identified either by the Service name and Product name input parameters or by the url of the dataset Extraction criteria can be specified: geographical coverage, time coverage, depth coverage. They are optional. Variable names to extract have to be set as input parameters. The return values are the status of the request (pending, in progress, done, error), the request identifer and the return process code (ok or error code) and the correponding message)

srv:operationDescription.gco:CharacterString:
Move or copy the result on an extraction to a specified uri The extraction is identified by its request number. Supported protocoled are ftp, sftp, file. The return values are the return process code (ok or error code) and the correponding message.
URI formats are :
ftp://host[:port]/directory/file sftp://host[:port]/directory/file
To access to the files on the local physical file system : [file://] absolute-path
Where absolute-path is a valid absolute file name for the local platform. UNC names are supported under Windows.
Examples : file:///home/someuser/somedir file:///C:/Documents and Settings file://///somehost/someshare/afile.txt /home/someuser/somedir c:\program files\some dir c:/program files/some dir
You can also encode a username and password within a url: ftp://user:password@host/path sftp://user:password@host/path
You can also set a username and password by using the parameters user and pwd.
To pass through a proxy, you can use the user parameter :
Example: Uri: ftp://my.proxy.com/directory/file User: "username@my.ftp.com" Pwd: "userpwd"

srv:description.gco:CharacterString: The unique id of the request
Remove the source after transfer A flag to point out if the source data have to be deleted after transfer. Default value if false.

Keep the destination file name. A flag to keep the same file name: destination file has the same name than source file. If true: the destination uri doesn't contain the file name (only directories). If false: the destination uri contains the file name. Default value if false.
The Latitude/Longitude bounding box = minlat,minlon,maxlat,maxlon : lower left corner then upper right corner
Minimum depth (z) of the spatial extraction ('surface' can be set as a zero depth)
Maximum depth (z) of the spatial extraction ('surface' can be set as a zero depth)
Data format of the extraction. Default value is 'netcdf'
To process request as a subscription (true). Default value is false
To process user as an anonymous one or not. Default value is true
The unique id of the request
Status of a request. 1 = DONE, 2 = ERROR, 3 = PENDING, 4 = IN PROGRESS

srv:operationDescription.gco:CharacterString: Process for data compression. The purpose of this operation is to compress data extraction, from a request identifier. The request identifier is provided by the result of an extraction process The return values are the input request identifier of the data and the return process code (ok or error code) and the correponding message. The input request identifier is set to output to be able to chain this operation with an another one

srv:description.gco:CharacterString: The unique id of the request
The unique id of the request
The Latitude/Longitude bounding box = minlat,minlon,maxlat,maxlon : lower left corner then upper right corner
Minimum depth (z) of the spatial extraction ('surface' can be set as a zero depth)
Maximum depth (z) of the spatial extraction ('surface' can be set as a zero depth)
Data format of the extraction. Default value is 'netcdf'
To process request as a subscription (true). Default value is false
To process user as an anonymous one or not. Default value is true
The unique id of the request
Status of a request. 1 = DONE, 2 = ERROR, 3 = PENDING, 4 = IN PROGRESS

srv:operationDescription.gco:CharacterString: Get the url of the extracted product. The purpose of this process is get the url of an extraction process from a request identifier. The request identifier is provided by the result of an extraction process. The return values are url of the data and the return process code (ok or error code) and the correponding message). The url can be empty is the extration has not be done yet (not done yet or in error)

srv:description.gco:CharacterString: The unique id of the request
The Latitude/Longitude bounding box = minlat,minlon,maxlat,maxlon : lower left corner then upper right corner
Minimum depth (z) of the spatial extraction ('surface' can be set as a zero depth)
Maximum depth (z) of the spatial extraction ('surface' can be set as a zero depth)
Data format of the extraction. Default value is 'netcdf'
To process request as a subscription (true). Default value is false
To process user as an anonymous one or not. Default value is true
The unique id of the request
Status of a request. 1 = DONE, 2 = ERROR, 3 = PENDING, 4 = IN PROGRESS
